title: (x) What is the "your neighbours" website font ? - a New Yorker {Patrick Witmer}
content:
Hi,  
Could anyone tell me what's the font used for the title of the site [Your Neighbours](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416062332/http:/yourneighbours.de/) ?  
Here is a screenshot :

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416062332im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_6240.gif)

Thanks for your help :)

Regards
author: Aure

comments.content: Reminds me of The New Yorker font, which sorry, I don't know what that is.

Hey hey,  
thanks your right :)  
The name of the font is... " [New Yorker](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416062332/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/new-yorker-type/)" :D
BTW, it’s not Wiescher’s version – see the E and the S, for example.

We have talked about the various New Yorker fonts (Irvin was the metal type original) a few times. I think the Rakowski version called "Upper West Side" was the only one with the correct Q. There is also one called "Manhattan".

- Mike Yanega
